title: How to Factory Reset a MacBook Without Knowing the Password

steps.title: Start your Mac in Recovery Mode.
steps.content: Start your Mac in Recovery Mode. Keep in mind that factory resetting your Mac or Macbook will erase all contents. [1] X Research source Apple Silicon : With the Mac turned off, press and hold the Power button until the startup screen appears. Click Options > Continue . Intel-based Mac : With the Mac turned off, press and hold Cmd + R , and then press the Power button. Release Cmd + R when you see the Apple logo.

steps.title: Select Disk Utility.
steps.content: Select Disk Utility . You can find this on the macOS Utilities screen.

steps.title: Select your boot disk.
steps.content: Select your boot disk. This can be found in the left sidebar. In most cases, it will be called Macintosh HD . Make sure you select the main disk and not the folders underneath it.

steps.title: Click Erase.
steps.content: Click Erase . This is in the top toolbar.

steps.title: Reformat the disk.
steps.content: Reformat the disk. Enter a new name for the disk and select APFS as the new format.

steps.title: Click Erase.
steps.content: Click Erase . This process may take a few moments. Once you see the confirmation message, you can exit Disk Utility.

steps.title: Select Reinstall macOS [version].
steps.content: Select Reinstall macOS [version] . This is on the Utilities screen.

steps.title: Follow the on-screen instructions.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen instructions. You'll be asked to select your disk before the installation begins. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Wait for the installation to complete.
steps.content: Wait for the installation to complete. This may take some time. Keep your Mac plugged in, and don't close the lid or put it to sleep. The screen may turn on and off periodically. Once it's complete, you'll see the setup assistant. You can now set up the new Mac.
